Introduction

We will use the TCP protocol for sending data between client and server.

Endianness

We will send everything in little endian as majority of our users will be using x86 based processors.

Sending strings

We could use Huffman coding to send large strings across the wire.

Connection Process

The server will ignore all messages other than Login before the player has successfully logged in.

  • Client sends Login
  • Server sends back LoginResponse
  • Server sends CharacterList

At this point the only accepted messages are CreateCharacter, SelectCharacter, or Logout.

  • Client sends SelectCharacter

At this point the server will send EntityCreate messages, followed by EntityUpdate messages as needed.

Header

Each message will have the following header: 

struct {
	uint8 messageType; // Type of message we're sending
	uint16 length; // Length of the message, ignored for fixed-length messages
}

Messages

How is "string" defined? Is it a char* with a \0 terminated array of chars? CyaNox 01:40, 14 October 2007 (CEST)

Login

Sent from client to server when the user wants to login. 

struct {
	string username;
	string password;
}

LoginResponse

Sent from server to client in repsponse to Login message. 

struct {
	bool accepted;
	string reason; // Reason rejected or blank if accepted
}

Logout

Sent from client to server when the user wants to logout.

It is an empty message. 

struct {
}

EntityCreate

Sent from server to client to indicate an entity has been created. 

struct {
	uint32 entityID; // ID to be used to refer to entity instance
	string entityType; // Type of entity to create
}


EntityRemove

Sent from server to client to indicate an entity has been removed. 

struct {
	uint32 entityID;
}

EntityUpdate

Sent from server to client to update an entity's properties. 

struct {
	uint32 entityID;
	uint16 updateCount; // Number of properties to update
	struct {
		uint16 propertyID; // Property to update
		ValueType value; // The value will be sent in the type specified in the entity definition.
	} PropertyUpdates[updateCount];
}

EntityOperation

Sent from one side to the other to call an operation on a specific component. 

struct {
	uint32 entityID;
	uint16 componentID;
	string operation;
}

This will be followed by a list of parameters to the operation.
